aws::graph::propositions: # Engine Connecting Rod and Crankshaft Examination Findings
Material displacement was present at the number 5 bearing journal.
All crankshaft oil tubes were clear of debris except for the number 6 connecting rod journal.
The number 6 connecting rod journal was mechanically damaged.
The number 1 connecting rod remained secured to the crankshaft.
The number 1 connecting rod remained secured to the piston pin.
The number 1 connecting rod displayed thermal discoloration.
The number 1 connecting rod showed evidence of heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication.
The oil feed to the number 1 bearing was clear of debris.
The number 1 connecting rod bearing displayed evidence of thermal discoloration.
The number 1 connecting rod bearing showed heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication.
The number 2 connecting rod remained secured to the crankshaft.
The number 2 connecting rod remained secured to the piston pin.
The number 2 connecting rod displayed thermal discoloration.
The number 2 connecting rod showed evidence of heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication.
The oil feed to the number 2 bearing was clear of debris.
The number 2 bearing displayed evidence of thermal discoloration.
The number 2 bearing showed heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication.
The number 3 connecting rod remained secured to the crankshaft.
The number 3 connecting rod remained secured to the piston pin.
The number 3 connecting rod showed no signs of operational distress.
The oil feed to the number 3 bearing was clear of debris.
The number 3 connecting rod bearing displayed some wear.
The number 3 connecting rod bearing did not show signs of thermal distress.
The number 3 connecting rod bearing did not show signs of lack of lubrication.
The number 4 connecting rod remained secured to the crankshaft.
The number 4 connecting rod remained secured to the piston pin.
The number 4 connecting rod showed no signs of operational distress.
The oil feed to the number 4 bearing was clear of debris.
The number 4 connecting rod bearing displayed some wear.
The number 4 connecting rod bearing did not show signs of thermal distress.
The number 4 connecting rod bearing did not show signs of lack of lubrication.
The number 5 connecting rod was fractured into four pieces.
The number 5 connecting rod pieces did not display thermal discoloration.
Mechanical damage was evident on all components of the number 5 connecting rod.
The piston end of the number 5 connecting rod remained attached to the piston pin.
The oil feed to the number 5 bearing was clear of debris.
The number 5 connecting rod bearing was liberated along with the fractured connecting rod.
The number 5 connecting rod bearing was mechanically damaged.
The number 5 connecting rod bearing showed little-to-no thermal distress.

text:
along with material displacement at the number 5 bearing journal
- All of the crankshaft oil tubes were clear of debris with the exception of the number 6 connecting rod journal, which was mechanically damaged

## The Number 1 Connecting Rod
- Remained secured to the crankshaft and the piston pin
- Displayed thermal discoloration and evidence of heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication
- The oil feed to the number 1 bearing was clear of debris
- The connecting rod bearing displayed evidence of thermal discoloration and heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication

## The Number 2 Connecting Rod
- Remained secured to the crankshaft and the piston pin
- Displayed thermal discoloration and evidence of heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication
- The oil feed to the number 2 bearing was clear of debris
- The bearing displayed evidence of thermal discoloration and heat distress associated with a lack of lubrication

## The Number 3 Connecting Rod
- Remained secured to the crankshaft and piston pin
- There were no signs of operational distress with the connecting rod
- The oil feed to the number 3 bearing was clear of debris
- The connecting rod bearing displayed some wear, but did not show the signs of thermal distress or lack of lubrication as the others

## The Number 4 Connecting Rod
- Remained secured to the crankshaft and piston pin
- There were no signs of operational distress with the connecting rod
- The oil feed to the number 4 bearing was clear of debris
- The connecting rod bearing displayed some wear, but did not show the signs of thermal distress or lack of lubrication as the others

## The Number 5 Connecting Rod
- Was fractured into four pieces, none of which displayed thermal discoloration
- Mechanical damage was evident on all of the components
- The piston end of the connecting rod remained attached to the piston pin
- The oil feed to the number 5 bearing was clear of debris
- The number 5 connecting rod bearing was liberated along with the fractured connecting rod
- The bearing was mechanically damaged but there was little-to-no thermal distress noted on the bearing

---
